info.headline: Severe Weather Statement issued June 03 at 9:52PM CDT until June 03 at 11:45PM CDT by NWS Lubbock
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 1030 PM CDT FOR EASTERN CASTRO...SWISHER AND WESTERN BRISCOE COUNTIES... At 952 PM CDT, a severe thunderstorm was located near Tulia, moving south at 25 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts and quarter size hail. SOURCE...West Texas Mesonet. The West Texas Mesonet station in Happy recorded a wind gust to 60 mph. IMPACT...Hail damage to vehicles is expected. Expect wind damage to roofs, siding, and trees. Locations impacted include... Tulia, Hart, Silverton, Kress, Happy, Vigo Park, Claytonville, Mackenzie Reservoir and Nazareth. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...1.00 IN WIND THREAT...OBSERVED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building. Torrential rainfall is occurring with this storm, and may lead to flash flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
